sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| OBJECTIVE: To compare the safety and effectiveness of vag-inal with oral misoprostol for induction of labor.

sentence: 27 ||| MATERIALS AND METHODS ||| 1.9 ||| Patients were eligible for inclusion if they presented with indications for induction and a single live fetus older than 37 weeks' gestation in cephalic presentation and no contraindication to vaginal delivery.
content: indications for induction and a single live fetus older than 37 weeks' gestation in cephalic presentation and no contraindication to vaginal delivery
label: po.Disease

sentence: 28 ||| MATERIALS AND METHODS ||| 1.10 ||| Patients with previous uterine surgery, known prostaglandin hypersensitiv- ity, three or more contractions per 10 minutes, nonreassuring fetal heart tracings, and those with vaginal birth contraindications were excluded from participation.
content: previous uterine surgery, known prostaglandin hypersensitiv- ity, three or more contractions per 10 minutes, nonreassuring fetal heart tracings, and those with vaginal birth contraindications
label: po.Disease

sentence: 3 |||  ||| 0.3 ||| Doses of 100 ␮g of oral or 25 ␮g of vaginal misoprostol were given every 3-4 hours.
content: Doses of 100 ␮g of oral or 25 ␮g of vaginal misoprostol were given every 3-4 hours
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 4 |||  ||| 0.4 ||| If cervical ripening or active labor did not occur, repeated doses of oral (100-200 ␮g) or vaginal (25-50 ␮g) were given until labor was established.
content: If cervical ripening or active labor did not occur, repeated doses of oral (100-200 ␮g) or vaginal (25-50 ␮g) were given
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 36 ||| MATERIALS AND METHODS ||| 1.18 ||| This was repeated every 3-4 hours until the occurrence of progressive labor (as evidenced by a Bishop score of 7 or more), a contraction pattern of three every 10 minutes, and evidence of fetal intolerance or delivery.
content: occurrence of progressive labor (as evidenced by a Bishop score of 7 or more)
label: i.Disease

sentence: 5 |||  ||| 0.5 ||| RESULTS: Fifty-nine women received oral misoprostol, and 48 received vaginal administration
content: Fifty-nine women received oral misoprostol, and 48 received vaginal administration
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 14 |||  ||| 0.14 ||| CONCLUSION: These findings indicate that, in a closely supervised hospital setting with adequate monitoring, oral misoprostol has the potential to induce labor as safely and effectively as its vaginal analogue.
content: oral misoprostol has the potential to induce labor as safely and effectively as its vaginal analogue
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 6 |||  ||| 0.6 ||| Delivery time was similar for the vaginal and oral arms (1074 ؎ 488 minutes versus 930 ؎ 454 minutes, P ‫؍‬ .11).

sentence: 57 ||| RESULTS ||| 2.6 ||| Nulliparous women receiving oral misoprostol were twice as likely to need assistance in delivery.
content: Nulliparous women receiving oral misoprostol were twice as likely to need assistance in delivery
